proposals.title: Headless Shopify Analytics Infrastructure & Conversion Tracking

timeline.description: Establish a solid foundation by ensuring GA4 is properly configured and capturing all relevant user interactions.
Enhance data quality and flexibility by shifting to server-side tracking and including profitability metrics.
Build a scalable and insightful analytics infrastructure through automated data pipelines and advanced dashboards.

tasks: Access to existing GA4 properties (with edit permissions)
Access to GTM containers (Web and App, if applicable)
Datalayer availability and consistency across website/app (requires your dev team to implemented)
Access to live staging/dev environments (if applicable for testing)
Website code access or shopify access
dependencies.title: Phase 0: GA4 Event Hygiene & Audit

tasks: Custom domain setup for server-side GTM (e.g., tag.domain.com with DNS and SSL)
Cloud environment (GCP/AWS) provisioned with necessary access/roles
Access to Shopify Admin and API credentials
Availability of hashed user identifiers (email, phone) in datalayer or any varaible
List of enriched attributes (e.g., product cost, logistics cost, customer segments)
Legal/Privacy team input for GDPR/CCPA compliance
dependencies.title: Phase 1: Server-Side Enrichment & Data Pipeline

tasks: Google Cloud project access for BigQuery setup
Google Ads and Meta Ads account access with data export permissions
BigQuery billing account configured and active
Access to Looker Studio with BigQuery connector permissions
Daily order data schema and Shopify API access
Pre-approved KPIs and stakeholder reporting requirements
Client-side report validation point of contact
dependencies.title: Phase 2: Data Ingestion & Reporting

tasks: Data pipeline construction for first/third-party data sources.
Creation of reports or dashboards not specified in this SOW.
Building any production-grade machine learning models.
Integration or optimization of other systems or tools not related to GA4.
We will not support on server side beyond shopify limited api which possible directly on custom tag, variable or client.
Any activities not explicitly mentioned in this scope.
Any delays caused by dependencies or access-related issues may impact the overall project timeline.
We are limiting the reporting scope to basic KPIs and standard reports based on available data source tables. Custom queries or data blending will not be included.
out_of_scope.title: The following are excluded from this project.

testimonials.text: Helped us unlock profit-level insights across all paid media.
testimonials.author: Lucía Martínez

testimonials.text: A strategic and technical partner who understands both business and data.
testimonials.author: Carlos Fernández

tasks: Conduct a thorough review of the current GA4 implementation.
Identify issues related to data accuracy, tracking configuration, and event setup.
Provide a detailed report outlining findings, including areas for improvement.
Address issues identified during the audit.
Implement recommended fixes, including correcting event tracking and parameters.
Configure enhanced measurement features for the custom event of 15 from the business point of view.
Standardize naming conventions for events and parameters.
Implement or update key events and conversions to ensure comprehensive tracking across the site.
Validate data accuracy using DebugView and Realtime reports.
Document tracking schema for future reference and alignment across teams.
scope_of_work.title: Phase 0: GA4 Event Hygiene & Audit

tasks: Deploy a server-side container using Google Tag Manager hosted on a secure server. Please assess the expected event volume and setup costs. We request your team's assistance in configuring the custom domain and cloud infrastructure.
Set up server endpoints for GA4, Meta Conversion API (CAPI), and Google Ads Conversion Tracking.
Ensure accurate mapping of client-side GA4 events to their server-side equivalents. This includes key events such as purchase, add_to_cart, view_item, and begin_checkout, among others.
Implement secure hashed identifiers (email, phone) alongside client_id, fbp, and fbc to support cross-platform attribution for GA4, Meta Ads, and Google Ads.
Ensure all event payloads follow the required schema for GA4, Google Ads and Meta CAPI, including custom parameters
Use GA4 DebugView and Meta Events Manager to test, validate, and troubleshoot server-side event delivery.
Create and maintain a comprehensive technical configuration document covering both GA4 server-side setup and Meta Conversion API implementation.
scope_of_work.title: Phase 1: Server-Side Enrichment & Data Pipeline

tasks: Set up automated data export from GA4 to BigQuery.
Use Google Ads native BigQuery connector to store data in bigquery (via Google Cloud).
Establish performance monitoring and alerting mechanisms for key metrics.
Use Meta Ads third party BigQuery connector to store data in bigquery (via ETL tool).
Implement ad-level reporting by BigQuery data with Meta Ads and Google Ads datasets.
We will integrate daily order data using the Shopify API, fetched via an Apps Script in Google Sheets.

Create 2-3 stakeholder-specific dashboards, each with a focused view: Marketing View: Spend, ROAS by Campaign & Channel , Product View: Revenue by SKU or Category, Finance View: Weekly POAS trends, Cost vs. Revenue, Use BigQuery connector in Looker Studio to avoid manual updates.
Segment reporting views Apply filters instead of building multiple pages/tabs to reduce processing load
Develop interactive and user-friendly dashboards in Looker Studio tailored for different stakeholders (marketing, product, finance).
scope_of_work.title: Phase 2: Data Ingestion & Reporting

timeline.description: Audit existing GA4 property, validate data streams, and configure automated GA4 to BigQuery export.
Build SQL models for user lifetime value, first acquisition touchpoints, and consecutive journey mapping by source/medium.

timeline.phase: Phase 2: Business Dashboard in Looker Studio
timeline.description: Develop interactive dashboards for KPIs, revenue trends, and user behavior with filtering by basic data table.

tasks: Access to GA4 property with edit permissions.
Access to Google Cloud Project and BigQuery datasets.
Permissions for Shopify backend (if required for enhanced events).
Validation of GA4 event schema (purchase, etc.).

tasks: Mapping of revenue and user identifiers (user_pseudo_id or client_id).
List of key business metrics for lifetime value and retention analysis.
dependencies.title: Phase 1: LTV & Acquisition Query Modelling

tasks: Looker Studio editor access.
Agreement on dashboard KPIs and visual layouts.
Stakeholder feedback loop for dashboard validation.
dependencies.title: Phase 2: Looker Studio Dashboard

tasks: Custom backend event tracking on GA4 unless explicitly requested (purchase).
Migration of non-Shopify or legacy datasets not stored in GA4.
Advanced ML models beyond basic predictive LTV (unless scoped separately).
Long-term maintenance or daily reporting beyond initial dashboard build.

Dashboard data refresh is based solely on the export capabilities of GA4 and its link to BigQuery. Only data collected after the connection date will be reflected on our new dashboard, as historical data is not available in the BigQuery dataset.

tasks: Audit GA4 configuration for event(purchase event) accuracy and parameters.
Set up GA4 → BigQuery daily export.
Create clean data models in BigQuery (sessions, transactions, user paths).
Document GA4-to-BigQuery schema for stakeholders.
scope_of_work.title: Phase 0: GA4 & BigQuery Setup

tasks: Write SQL queries for user LTV (revenue per user).
Map first-touch acquisition source and medium.
Build journey-wise paths (first → consecutive sources).
Segment users by acquisition type for deeper insights.
A single dashboard page for the entire journey
scope_of_work.title: Phase 1: LTV & Acquisition Analysis

tasks: Develop a core dashboard with KPIs: sessions, revenue, LTV, and acquisition sources.
Create drill-down views for user id wise campaigns.
Implement filters for date range, device type, and traffic source.
Optimize dashboards for performance and clarity.

technology_stack.name: Styling: Tailwind CSS / Styled Components
technology_stack.role: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid, consistent styling

technology_stack.name: Headless CMS: Strapi / Contentful / Sanity.io
technology_stack.role: Flexible and user-friendly content management for watches

technology_stack.name: Hosting: Vercel / Netlify
technology_stack.role: High-performance deployment and CDN for static assets & serverless functions

technology_stack.name: Email Notifications: Node.js (with Nodemailer/SendGrid)
technology_stack.role: Backend logic for sending inquiry notifications

proposals.executive_summary: This proposal outlines the strategy and execution plan for creating a bespoke luxury e-commerce website for your watch business, drawing inspiration from leading platforms like Wristcheck.com and shop.getbezel.com. The primary goal is to deliver an elegant, immersive, and highly polished retail-facing site that showcases your inventory with premium design and facilitates inquiry-based purchases.
proposals.problem_statement: The client requires a sophisticated online presence to showcase a luxury watch inventory. The current approach lacks an elegant, immersive, and conversion-optimized platform to effectively present high-value products and streamline the inquiry-to-purchase process.

proposed_solution.overview: We propose developing a custom-coded, highly responsive luxury e-commerce website with an editorial-style design. The site will feature intuitive product Browse, filtering, wishlist functionality, and a seamless inquiry-based checkout flow. A user-friendly CMS will be integrated for effortless inventory management. While not handling direct payments, the site will be designed for maximum visual impact and lead generation.
key_features: Premium, editorial-style UI/UX design (clean, modern, luxurious)
Core Pages: Home, Product Listing Page (PLP), Individual Product Pages (PDP)
Wishlist functionality for logged-in or guest users
Inquiry functionality on PDPs and throughout the site
Streamlined Checkout Flow leading to 'Contact us to complete your purchase' message
Automated email/notification trigger to client upon checkout completion
Integrated Headless CMS for easy watch listing and management
Fully responsive design for optimal viewing on all devices (mobile, tablet, desktop)
Optional: Subtle animations, parallax effects, and refined micro-interactions

timeline.description: Connect to Google Ads and CTM APIs, validate credentials, and define BigQuery schema.
Set up data ingestion jobs, validate data storage in BigQuery, and deploy scheduled functions.
Implement rule-based logic and configure Slack/email alert delivery with summaries.
Test all pipelines and alerts, refine thresholds, and finalize deployment documentation.

tasks: Access to Google Ads Manager account with developer token and credentials.
CallTrackingMetrics API credentials and endpoint access.
Google Cloud project with BigQuery and Cloud Functions enabled.
Slack webhook or SMTP credentials for alerts.
Predefined rules or KPIs for monitoring (or agreement on a minimal rule set).
dependencies.title: Phase 1: Data Ingestion & Monitoring Setup

tasks: UI or dashboard development.
Data ingestion from sources other than Google Ads or CTM.
Long-term monitoring and maintenance beyond handover.
Advanced anomaly detection using ML or forecasting models.
Integration with internal CRM or ticketing tools.
Any production-grade alert delivery pipelines (email servers, Slack bots beyond basic setup).
out_of_scope.title: The following are excluded from this project.

testimonials.text: Great Team for our Infra building on cloud. The team exceeded expectations.
testimonials.author: Paul Soloman

tasks: Connect to Google Ads API using Python SDK and extract key metrics (e.g., impressions, conversions, cost).
Connect to CallTrackingMetrics (CTM) API and extract call-related data (duration, caller ID, source, etc.).
Clean and normalize data from both sources and design an appropriate schema for BigQuery storage.
Set up scheduled data fetching using Cloud Functions (daily or hourly based on feasibility).
Create basic monitoring rules such as: campaigns with 0 impressions, CTR drop > 50%, cost increase > threshold, low daily conversions.
Trigger alerts via email or Slack (can be plain text or structured JSON) using a defined message format.
Ensure modular, well-documented Python code and provide deployment instructions for GCP.
Provide basic operational documentation covering setup, configuration, and rule extension.
scope_of_work.title: Phase 1: Data Ingestion & Performance Monitoring

scope_of_work.title: Phase 0: GTM Audit & Shopify Code Transition
tasks: Conduct detailed audit of GTM container to identify performance issues.
Evaluate GTM impact on page speed (especially PDPs).
Recommend GTM-lite approach and move core tracking (GA4) into Shopify theme.
Provide code snippets for Shopify theme-based event tracking.
Limit GTM use to marketing/non-critical tags.
Document the new tracking architecture (Shopify native + GTM marketing tags).

tasks: Define and document Shopify-to-GA4 standard events.
Establish naming conventions and recommended parameters.

tasks: Connect GA4 to Looker Studio (direct/native).
Create a Looker Studio dashboard with key views: Sales, Marketing ROAS, Product, Finance.
Document dashboard logic and data sources for internal use.

proposals.title: User Data Storage Solutions for Betachon Courier Page

pricing.title: Frontend + Google AppScript API Integration (No Backend)
Node.js Backend + MongoDB Storage + Vercel Hosting
Node.js Backend with AppScript Proxy API (No Database)

timeline.description: Identify the most viable solution (1, 2, or 3) based on project constraints and traffic expectations.
Implement selected approach, test API endpoints, and integrate into courier page.

tasks: Frontend access for courier page integration.
AppScript project access if Solution 1 or 3 is selected.
MongoDB Atlas account access (for Solution 2).
Custom domain configuration access (for Vercel deployment in Solution 2 & 3).
dependencies.title: Project Dependencies

tasks: Implement Google AppScript to receive data and write to Google Sheets.
Integrate AppScript endpoint into frontend using fetch API.
No backend server required.
Lightweight and temporary solution.
Risk of API getting blocked by Google if traffic spikes.
scope_of_work.title: Solution 1: AppScript + Frontend Only (Temporary)

tasks: Create Node.js backend to receive form data from courier page.
Store user details in MongoDB (512MB free with scalability).
Host backend on Vercel using custom domain (as HostGator doesn't support Node).
Reliable and scalable, minor hosting cost after database limit.
scope_of_work.title: Solution 2: Node.js Backend + MongoDB (Scalable)

tasks: Create Node.js backend with custom domain API endpoint.
Backend API acts as a proxy to AppScript to write into Google Sheets.
No database used, AppScript handles storage.
Eliminates risk of AppScript API getting blocked via direct frontend calls.
Balanced and semi-permanent solution with less risk.
scope_of_work.title: Solution 3: Node.js Backend as AppScript Proxy (No DB)
